Subjective: Sore throat x3 days. Fever this morning. Cough last week, now resolved. Painful swallowing, unbearable. Meds: Paracetamol, Ibuprofen, no relief. Negatives: No shortness of breath, no runny nose. Social: Friend had abscess. ICE: Worried about abscess, wants antibiotics.
Objective: Temp 38.3 C. Ears: Left eardrum air-filled, normal. Right ear canal red, otherwise normal. Neck: Small submandibular lymph nodes, non-pathological. Throat: Uvula midline, red pharyngeal arch, enlarged tonsils without kissing, bilateral slough. Lungs: Vesicular breath sounds, no adventitious sounds. Saturation 98%.
Assessment: Viral pharyngitis. Suspected bacterial abscess ruled out.
Plan: 1. Explanation of viral nature. 2. Paracetamol 1000mg 4x daily. 3. Ibuprofen 400mg 3x daily. 4. Advice: Cold drinks, popsicles. 5. Safety net: Contact if worsening, shortness of breath, or inability to swallow.
